segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: This parent checklist includes cross-reference links to important concepts about the domain isolation policy design.
segment.target: This parent checklist includes cross-reference links to important concepts about the domain isolation policy design.

segment.source: It also contains links to subordinate checklists that will help you complete the tasks that are required to implement this design.
segment.target: It also contains links to subordinate checklists that will help you complete the tasks that are required to implement this design.

segment.source: Note: Complete the tasks in this checklist in order.
segment.target: Note: Complete the tasks in this checklist in order.

segment.source: When a reference link takes you to a procedure, return to this topic after you complete the steps in that procedure so that you can proceed with the remaining tasks in this checklist.
segment.target: When a reference link takes you to a procedure, return to this topic after you complete the steps in that procedure so that you can proceed with the remaining tasks in this checklist.

segment.source: The procedures in this section use the Group Policy MMC snap-ins to configure the GPOs, but you can also use Windows PowerShell to configure GPOs.
segment.target: The procedures in this section use the Group Policy MMC snap-ins to configure the GPOs, but you can also use Windows PowerShell to configure GPOs.

segment.source: For more info, see Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Administration with Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For more info, see Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Administration with Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Checklist: Implementing a domain isolation policy design
segment.target: Checklist: Implementing a domain isolation policy design

segment.target: Task

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Review important concepts and examples for the domain isolation policy design, determine your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security deployment goals, and customize this design to meet the needs of your organization.
segment.target: Review important concepts and examples for the domain isolation policy design, determine your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security deployment goals, and customize this design to meet the needs of your organization.

segment.target: Identifying Your Windows Firewall with Advanced Security Deployment Goals

segment.source: Create the GPOs and connection security rules for the isolated domain.
segment.target: Create the GPOs and connection security rules for the isolated domain.

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain

segment.target: Create the GPOs and connection security rules for the boundary zone.

segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone

segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Encryption Zone

segment.target: Create the GPOs and connection security rules for the isolated server zone.

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring Rules for an Isolated Server Zone
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for an Isolated Server Zone

segment.source: According to the testing and roll-out schedule in your design plan, add computer accounts to the membership group to deploy rules and settings to your computers.
segment.target: According to the testing and roll-out schedule in your design plan, add computer accounts to the membership group to deploy rules and settings to your computers.

segment.source: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone
segment.target: Add Production Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone

segment.source: After you confirm that network traffic is authenticated by IPsec, you can change authentication rules for the isolated domain and encryption zone from request to require mode.
segment.target: After you confirm that network traffic is authenticated by IPsec, you can change authentication rules for the isolated domain and encryption zone from request to require mode.

segment.source: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode
segment.target: Change Rules from Request to Require Mode
